result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell Davis Ferrie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.  Costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted.
Maintain full-time employment as directed by DOC.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell Davis Ferrie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from defendant requesting credit for time served. Court responds - in 16-CM-110, defendant bonded out after 1 day. Apparently is getting credit for that. In 16-CM-121, defendant sat on cash bond for 8/22/16 to 9/07/16. Must be 14 days defendant is referring to in letter. He was placed on probation in that file. Will only get credit for days sat if he's revoked. DTE
Inmate request form - defendant requests breakdown of fines/costs and how cash bonds were applied. Clerk sent copy of assessment report to defendant in the jail.
to Scott Butters, check #10405.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Change of attorney
Defendant is currently staying at the Frontier Campground.
Defendant is no longer staying at the Nightengale Motel.

Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers requests a status in 30-45 days to allow him time to look into some possible defenses. Bond remains in effect.  Status scheduled for 10/31/16 at 11:30 am.
by Scott Butters

Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that parties are close to agreement, advises that Defendant has things to get into place for Huber, questions whether bond could be amended for 5-7 days to allow that to happen before entering plea. State presents argument against amendment of bond. Court will not amend bond. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Door County Jail

Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of progress toward resolution, requests that case be put back on calendar ASAP.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Atty Gerbers would like to resolve both cases yet this week. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 8/21/16.

No contact direct or indirect with Potawatomi State Park.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Russell Davis Ferrie appears by video along with attorney Elisabeth Lynn Stockbridge who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 8/29/16 at 10:00 am.
